title: Canadian Wildfires Are Burning Where They Rarely Have Before
description: Of the more than 400 fires burning in Canada, more than one-third are in Quebec, which has little experience with so many and such large wildfires.

title: Blinken’s Visit to Saudi Arabia Caps Biden Effort to Rebuild Ties
description: Biden aides are closely watching Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s overtures to China, his attitude toward Israel and his balancing act with Russia and Ukraine.

title: Ukraine Attacks Russian Positions as Signs of Counteroffensive Grow
description: The assaults, with Western tanks and armored vehicles, appear to mark a long-awaited counteroffensive that Ukraine hopes will retake territory and shore up allies’ resolve to keep supplying weapons.

title: Zelensky Visits Kherson, and Russia Shells Flooded City
description: President Volodymyr Zelensky traveled to the city of Kherson, trying to rally rescue crews. Russian forces shelled the city not long after his visit.

title: Your Friday Briefing: A Major Ukrainian Offensive
description: Also, a victory for voting rights in the U.S.

title: FDA Panel Recommends RSV Shot to Protect Infants
description: Write a summary here and then click the Summary toggle above so it only shows up in the metadata field.

title: Wild Mammals Roamed When Covid Kept Humans Home
description: Strict pandemic lockdowns may have allowed animals to range more widely and spend time closer to roads, a new study suggests.

title: U.S. Suspends Food Aid for Ethiopia, Citing Widespread Theft
description: American officials say they uncovered a countrywide scheme to divert food aid to “military units,” in a country where 20 million people rely on donated relief.

title: How Phone Messages Sped the Fall of President Milo Djukanovic in Montenegro
description: Evidence found in encrypted messages helped speed the fall of Milo Djukanovic in Montenegro. His successor, Jakov Milatovic, says he plans to clean up the country.

title: Kherson is hit by Russian shelling hours after a Zelensky visit.
description: Ukraine’s interior ministry said that eight people were injured in an attack near an evacuation point where medics, emergency workers and rescue teams have been gathering.

title: Man Tied to Natalee Holloway Disappearance Is Put on Extradition Flight to U.S.
description: Joran van der Sloot, who had been in prison in Peru, was sent to the United States to face charges related to Ms. Holloway, who went missing during a 2005 trip to Aruba.

title: Pope Francis Is Doing Well After Hernia Surgery, Vatican Says
description: The 86-year old pontiff had a peaceful night, and was alert and breathing on his own a day after he underwent surgery to treat a hernia, an official statement reported.

title: Wildfire Smoke From Canada Is Expected to Reach Norway
description: Scientists in Norway have observed the effects of the fires, some of which have been burning for weeks.

title: Ukraine Attacks in South, Part of What Russia Calls a Counteroffensive
description: The fighting in the south follows a claim earlier this week that the counteroffensive had started farther east.

title: Zelensky Visits Kherson as Flood Rescues Enter Third Day
description: With parts of the Kherson region under an average of 18 feet of water, President Volodymyr Zelensky called for a swift global response to the destruction of a critical dam.

title: Satellite Images Show Scale of Flooding From Ukraine Dam Collapse
description: Photographs released by Planet Lab offer some of the clearest glimpses yet of the situation in cities and villages downstream from the destroyed Kakhovka dam in Ukraine.

title: Wildfire Smoke Envelops the U.S.
description: New York City experienced its worst air quality on record. Here’s how to stay safe as the smoke spreads.

title: Man Stabs Several People, Including Children, in France, Authorities Say
description: The motive for the attack, in the southeastern city of Annecy, was not immediately clear.

title: China’s Crackdown on Mosque Domes is Drawing Rare Resistance
description: China is destroying Arab-style architectural features of mosques, such as domes and minarets. The tightened control on religion has been met with rare resistance.

title: Record Pollution and Heat Herald a Season of Climate Extremes
description: Scientists have long warned that global warming will increase the chance of severe wildfires like those burning across Canada and heat waves like the one smothering Puerto Rico.

title: Cross-Border Skirmishes Heighten Anxiety for Ukrainian Villagers
description: Even as new attacks have brought the war into Russia, the Russians have responded with force, raising the threat for the few civilians left in towns along the border.

title: Biden and Sunak Set to Discuss the Economy, A.I. and Ukraine
description: The U.K. prime minister is under pressure to establish post-Brexit Britain as a reliable global player and is looking to strengthen economic ties.

title: Canada Wildfires Renew Calls for a National Fire Service
description: Prime Minister Trudeau said he spoke to President Biden by phone to offer thanks for the American firefighters on the scene.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Residents along the Dnipro River face devastation after the destruction of a key dam.

title: What Is the Saudi Sovereign Wealth Fund?
description: The secretive $700 billion investment fund has set its sights on tourism, job creation, private equity and, now, golf.
